payload.description: A beautiful web UI for browsing Claude Code conversation history.

issue.title: "Chain of Thought" and "Tree of Thought" are classified incorrectly as Architectures
issue.body:
**Description**
Hi team, thanks for the [AI Agents Roadmap](https://roadmap.sh/ai-agents)! I noticed a technical inaccuracy in the classification of concepts within the **"Agent Architectures"** section.

**The Issue**
The roadmap currently lists **Chain of Thought (CoT)** and **Tree of Thought (ToT)** as types of "Architectures"
*   **Chain of Thought** is listed under "Common Architectures"
*   **Tree of Thought** is listed under "Other Architecture Patterns"

**Technical Context**
In the context of LLMs and Agents, these concepts are **Prompting** or **Reasoning Strategies**, not **Agent Architectures**.

*   **Agent Architectures** (like *ReAct*, *Plan-and-Solve*, or *Multi-Agent Systems*) refer to the software control flow, loops, and tool-execution logic.
*   **Chain/Tree of Thought** refers to the specific reasoning method (inference pattern) used *inside* the model's generation.

Classifying them as architectures implies they are alternatives to patterns like ReAct, whereas in reality, a ReAct agent almost always *uses* Chain of Thought as its reasoning engine. Grouping them together may create conceptual confusion.

issue.title: Shortcut keyboard keys are not working in roadmaps

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

issue.body: ### What is the URL where the issue is happening https://roadmap.sh/ai-engineer ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? Microsoft Edge ### Describe the Bug - here the red marked area, where you can set status of cards to done, pending or reset, with keyobard keys like *L*, *R* are not working. ### Output from browser console (if any) _No response_ ### Participation - [ ] I am willing to submit a pull request for this issue.

issue.title: Proposal: Open Source Engineer Roadmap (Contributor-led implementation)
issue.body:
### What is the title of the roadmap you are submitting?

Roadmap to learn open source engineering

### Roadmap Link

https://roadmap.sh/r/open-source-lq17v
Hi roadmap.sh team 👋,

I’ve been on a personal journey to become a consistent open source contributor, and along the way I noticed a recurring problem:  
many developers *want* to contribute to open source, but struggle to find a clear, structured path on **how to actually get started and grow**.

To address this, I created an **Open Source Engineer roadmap** on roadmap.sh:
https://roadmap.sh/r/open-source-lq17v

The goal of this roadmap is to guide developers through:
- understanding open source culture and workflows
- finding beginner-friendly projects
- making their first meaningful contributions
- growing into consistent, long-term contributors

I shared this publicly and received encouraging feedback, including from the roadmap.sh team, which motivated me to take the next step.

### Proposal
I’d love to formally propose this roadmap for inclusion in roadmap.sh and **volunteer to implement and maintain it** as a contributor, incorporating community and team feedback as needed.

I believe this roadmap aligns well with roadmap.sh’s mission of providing clear, practical guidance, especially for developers who feel stuck at the “I want to contribute, but don’t know how” stage.

Happy to:
- refine the roadmap structure
- adjust scope or ordering
- follow existing roadmap.sh conventions
- maintain and iterate on it long-term

Thank you for the incredible work you do for the developer community.
Looking forward to your thoughts.

issue.title: Unable to close the User Progress Popup

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

issue.body: ### What is the URL where the issue is happening https://roadmap.sh/ai-data-scientist?s=68f9af1b32ad652bc8e7d5cc ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? Firefox ### Describe the Bug This bug can be reproduced by following the steps below: - Login to roadmap.sh - Go to the profile (https://roadmap.sh/u/[your_username]) - Click on any roadmap to access under the "Skills I have mastered" section. - It will take you to a new tab with the pop-up of the user progress, on top of the usual roadmap resources page. The pop-up mentions, "You can close this pop-up and start tracking your progress." However, there's no way to close the pop-up. Everything in the pop-up is non-functional. I can somehow close the pop-up by changing the link from: https://roadmap.sh/ai-data-scientist?s=68f9af1b32ad652bc8e7d5cc To: https://roadmap.sh/ai-data-scientist However, this causes the problem where the entire progress is reset. The only way I can keep track of the progress is by going through the link with the pop-up. ### Output from browser console (if any) _No response_ ### Participation - [ ] I am willing to submit a pull request for this issue.

issue.title: Commit count no longer available for PushEvent, affecting GitHub User Activity CLI project requirements
issue.body:
### Detailed Description

GitHub recently [announced changes to the Activity Events API](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-08-08-upcoming-changes-to-github-events-api-payloads/) which removed commit counts from the `PushEvent`, affecting the expected output in the requirements for the [GitHub User Activity CLI](https://roadmap.sh/projects/github-user-activity) project.

Commit counts can still be fetched using API endpoints for commits and doing a commit comparison; however, it might be helpful to modify the expected output to exclude commit counts and add fetching commit counts as an option for those looking to build a more advanced version of the project.
